intro: Licaria simulans, commonly known as the false licorice, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Licaria simulans is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
